_header: Thomas one of the twelve that his two name was
Note:
Treated here separately, but perhaps best thought of as a subsection of 787, within which it occurs. See Pickering (1973)
XPickering, Oliver S. “The Temporale Narratives of the South English Legendary.” Anglia 91 (1973): 425-55.
_description: In die sancti Thome Apostoli, in the Temporale of the South English Legendary

Bod779.First Lines:
tomas on of þe twelue þat in to name wasI cleped tomas
                    longe in doute myd þe oþer nouȝt nas…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…& bryng vs to oure eritage In to þy wonyngþou
                    graunte vs lord þat we so mote Ihesus almyȝty kyng
Bod779.Note: No heading so treated as part of 787 in this MS

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Thomas on of þe twelue þat his to Nome wasI clept Thomas
                    long in doute wiþ þe oþere nas…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…So þat hit schal hem turne to wel þe more pyneAnd
                    to alle þat goode beoþ to þe more blisse atte fyne
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
Thomas on of þe twelue þat long þer after wasy
                    cleped thomas long in doute wiþ þe oþere was…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…So it shal hem turne to wel more pyneAnd to alle þat
                    gode beoþ to more blisse atte fine

BodTan17.First Lines:
Thomas on of þe xij þat I clepid wasThomas longe in doute
                    wiþ þe oþere nas…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…So it schal hem turne to wel þe more peyneAnd to alle
                    þat goode ben to more blis atte fynde
BodTan17.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

OxfTri57.First Lines:
Thomas on of þe twelue þat in to long wasI clepud Thomas
                    longe in doute with þe oþere noȝt nas…
OxfTri57.Last Lines:
…so it schel hem turne to wel þe more pyneand to alle
                    þat guode beþ to þe more ioye & fyne

CamKC13.First Lines:
Thomas on of þe twelue wiþ þe oþere nouȝt
                    nasþat yclepid was Thomas longe in doute & þat his to name
                    was…
CamKC13.Last Lines:
…So þat þat it schal ham turne to wel þe more
                    pyneAnd to alle þat gode beþ to þe more ioie atte
                    fyne

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Thomas on of þe twelue þat in to name wasycluped Thomas
                    longe in doute myd þe oþere nouȝt nas…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…So þat hit shal ham turne to wel þe more pyneAnd to
                    alle þat goede beoþ to þe more ioye atte ffyne

BLEge2891.First Lines: Thomas on of þe twelue þat In thonome wasIcluped thomas longe in doute mid þe oþer non nas…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …So þat it ssel ȝam turne to wel þe more pineAnd to alle þat gode beoþ to þe more blisse atte fine

BLHar2277.First Lines: Thomas on of þe tuelue þat his tuo name wasIcliped Thomas longe in doute mid þoþere noȝt nas…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …So þat hit schal be turne to wel þe more pyne& to alle þat gode beoþ to þe more blisse atte fyne
